description: Malcolm reports to Duncan that the former Thane of Cawdor has been executed, noting his contrition before death.
Duncan thanks Macbeth and Banquo profusely for their valor in battle, declaring himself in their debt.
Duncan proclaims Malcolm the Prince of Cumberland, establishing him as heir to the Scottish throne.
Aside, Macbeth recognizes Malcolm's elevation as an obstacle he must either yield to or overcome to reach the crown.
Duncan declares that he will honor Macbeth by traveling to Inverness and staying at his castle.
Macbeth offers to ride ahead to Inverness as the king's harbinger and alert Lady Macbeth of the royal visit.
